## Classes

### <a name="freeradius"></a>`freeradius`

Installs the base server. In the early releases, this class does not have many parameters as most values are hard-coded. I am working on
parameterising more of the global settings to increase flexibility. Patches are welcome.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius` class:

* [`control_socket`](#-freeradius--control_socket)
* [`max_servers`](#-freeradius--max_servers)
* [`max_requests`](#-freeradius--max_requests)
* [`max_request_time`](#-freeradius--max_request_time)
* [`mysql_support`](#-freeradius--mysql_support)
* [`pgsql_support`](#-freeradius--pgsql_support)
* [`perl_support`](#-freeradius--perl_support)
* [`utils_support`](#-freeradius--utils_support)
* [`ldap_support`](#-freeradius--ldap_support)
* [`dhcp_support`](#-freeradius--dhcp_support)
* [`krb5_support`](#-freeradius--krb5_support)
* [`wpa_supplicant`](#-freeradius--wpa_supplicant)
* [`winbind_support`](#-freeradius--winbind_support)
* [`log_destination`](#-freeradius--log_destination)
* [`syslog`](#-freeradius--syslog)
* [`syslog_facility`](#-freeradius--syslog_facility)
* [`log_auth`](#-freeradius--log_auth)
* [`preserve_mods`](#-freeradius--preserve_mods)
* [`correct_escapes`](#-freeradius--correct_escapes)
* [`manage_logpath`](#-freeradius--manage_logpath)
* [`package_ensure`](#-freeradius--package_ensure)
* [`radacctdir`](#-freeradius--radacctdir)

##### <a name="-freeradius--control_socket"></a>`control_socket`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use of the `control_socket` parameter in the freeradius class is deprecated. Use the `freeradius::control_socket` class instead.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--max_servers"></a>`max_servers`

Data type: `Integer`

Limit on the total number of servers running.

Default value: `4096`

##### <a name="-freeradius--max_requests"></a>`max_requests`

Data type: `Integer`

The maximum number of requests which the server keeps track of. This should be 256 multiplied by the number of clients.

Default value: `4096`

##### <a name="-freeradius--max_request_time"></a>`max_request_time`

Data type: `Integer`

The maximum time (in seconds) to handle a request.

Default value: `30`

##### <a name="-freeradius--mysql_support"></a>`mysql_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install support for MySQL. Note this only installs the package. Use `freeradius::sql` to configure SQL support.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--pgsql_support"></a>`pgsql_support`

Data type: `Boolean`



Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--perl_support"></a>`perl_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install support for Perl.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--utils_support"></a>`utils_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install FreeRADIUS utils.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--ldap_support"></a>`ldap_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install support for LDAP.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--dhcp_support"></a>`dhcp_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install support for DHCP.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--krb5_support"></a>`krb5_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install support for Kerberos.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--wpa_supplicant"></a>`wpa_supplicant`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install `wpa_supplicant` utility.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--winbind_support"></a>`winbind_support`

Data type: `Boolean`

Add the radius user to the winbind privileged group. You must install winbind separately.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--log_destination"></a>`log_destination`

Data type: `Enum['files', 'syslog', 'stdout', 'stderr']`

Configure destination of log messages.

Default value: `'files'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--syslog"></a>`syslog`

Data type: `Boolean`

Add a syslog rule (using the `saz/rsyslog` module).

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--syslog_facility"></a>`syslog_facility`

Data type: `String`

Configure which syslog facility to use when `log_destination` is set to `syslog`

Default value: `'daemon'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--log_auth"></a>`log_auth`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Log authentication requests (yes/no).

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--preserve_mods"></a>`preserve_mods`

Data type: `Boolean`

Leave recommended stock modules enabled.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-freeradius--correct_escapes"></a>`correct_escapes`

Data type: `Boolean`

Use correct backslash escaping in unlang.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-freeradius--manage_logpath"></a>`manage_logpath`

Data type: `Boolean`



Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-freeradius--package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Choose whether the package is just installed and left (`installed`), or updated every Puppet run (`latest`)

Default value: `'installed'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--radacctdir"></a>`radacctdir`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `$freeradius::params::radacctdir`

### <a name="freeradius--control_socket"></a>`freeradius::control_socket`

Configure the FreeRADIUS control_socket

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::control_socket` class:

* [`mode`](#-freeradius--control_socket--mode)

##### <a name="-freeradius--control_socket--mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `Enum['ro', 'rw']`

Whether the control socket should be read-only or read-write.

Default value: `'ro'`

### <a name="freeradius--module--preprocess"></a>`freeradius::module::preprocess`

Install a preprocess module to process _huntgroups_ and _hints_ files.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::preprocess` class:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--ensure)
* [`moddir`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--moddir)
* [`huntgroups`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--huntgroups)
* [`hints`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--hints)
* [`with_ascend_hack`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_ascend_hack)
* [`ascend_channels_per_line`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--ascend_channels_per_line)
* [`with_ntdomain_hack`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_ntdomain_hack)
* [`with_specialix_jetstream_hack`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_specialix_jetstream_hack)
* [`with_cisco_vsa_hack`](#-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_cisco_vsa_hack)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present','absent']`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--moddir"></a>`moddir`

Data type: `String`

Directory where the preprocess' files are located.

Default value: `"\${modconfdir}/\${.:instance}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--huntgroups"></a>`huntgroups`

Data type: `String`

Path for the huntgroups file.

Default value: `"\${moddir}/huntgroups"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--hints"></a>`hints`

Data type: `String`

Path for the hints file.

Default value: `"\${moddir}/hints"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_ascend_hack"></a>`with_ascend_hack`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

This hack changes Ascend's weird port numbering to standar 0-??? port numbers.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--ascend_channels_per_line"></a>`ascend_channels_per_line`

Data type: `Integer`



Default value: `23`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_ntdomain_hack"></a>`with_ntdomain_hack`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Windows NT machines often authenticate themselves as `NT_DOMAIN\username`.
If this parameter is set to `yes`, then the `NT_DOMAIN` portion of the user-name is silently discarded.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_specialix_jetstream_hack"></a>`with_specialix_jetstream_hack`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Set to `yes` if you are using a Specialix Jetstream 8500 access server.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preprocess--with_cisco_vsa_hack"></a>`with_cisco_vsa_hack`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Set to `yes` if you are using a Cisco or Quintum NAS.

Default value: `'no'`

### <a name="freeradius--params"></a>`freeradius::params`

Default parameters for freeradius

### <a name="freeradius--radsniff"></a>`freeradius::radsniff`

Configures and runs the RADSNIFF service. It requires freeradius-utils to be installed, so will fail if `utils_support` is not enabled on
the `freeradius` class.

Note: This is only supported on RedHat like systems at present.

* **See also**
  * https://freeradius.org/radiusd/man/radsniff.html

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::radsniff` class:

* [`envfile`](#-freeradius--radsniff--envfile)
* [`options`](#-freeradius--radsniff--options)
* [`pidfile`](#-freeradius--radsniff--pidfile)

##### <a name="-freeradius--radsniff--envfile"></a>`envfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

path to the environment file, used by the systemd unit

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--radsniff--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `String`

commandline options passed to radsniff when it runs

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-freeradius--radsniff--pidfile"></a>`pidfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

path of the pidfile to be used

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--status_server"></a>`freeradius::status_server`

Enable status-server

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::status_server` class:

* [`port`](#-freeradius--status_server--port)
* [`listen`](#-freeradius--status_server--listen)

##### <a name="-freeradius--status_server--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The port to listen for status requests on.

Default value: `18121`

##### <a name="-freeradius--status_server--listen"></a>`listen`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The address to listen on. Defaults to listen on all addresses but you could set this to `$::ipaddress` or `127.0.0.1`.

Default value: `'*'`

## Defined types

### <a name="freeradius--attr"></a>`freeradius::attr`

Install FreeRADIUS config snippets

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::attr { 'eduroamlocal':
  key    => 'User-Name',
  prefix => 'attr_filter',
  source => 'puppet:///modules/site_freeradius/eduroamlocal',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::attr` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--attr--source)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--attr--ensure)
* [`key`](#-freeradius--attr--key)
* [`prefix`](#-freeradius--attr--prefix)
* [`relaxed`](#-freeradius--attr--relaxed)

##### <a name="-freeradius--attr--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `String`



##### <a name="-freeradius--attr--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--attr--key"></a>`key`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specify a RADIUS attribute to be the key for this attribute filter. Enter only the string part of the name.

Default value: `'User-Name'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--attr--prefix"></a>`prefix`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specify the prefix for the attribute filter name before the dot, e.g. `filter.post_proxy`. This is usually set to `filter` on FR2 and
`attr_filter` on FR3.

Default value: `'filter'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--attr--relaxed"></a>`relaxed`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Whether the filter removes or copies unmatched attributes, relaxed = no or yes respectively. An undefined value results in no
explicit statement, causing the default behaviour of FreeRADIUS equivalent to 'relaxed = no'.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--blank"></a>`freeradius::blank`

Selectively blank certain stock config files that aren't required. This is preferable to deleting them
because the package manager will replace certain files next time the package is upgraded, potentially
causing unexpected behaviour.

The resource title should be the relative path from the FreeRADIUS config directory to the file(s) you
want to blank. You can pass multiple files in an array.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::blank { 'sites-enabled/default': }

freeradius::blank { [
  'sites-enabled/default',
  'eap.conf',
]: }
```

### <a name="freeradius--cert"></a>`freeradius::cert`

Install certificates as provided. These are installed in `certs`.
Beware that any certificates *not* deployed by Puppet will be purged from this directory.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::cert { 'mycert.pem':
  source => 'puppet:///modules/site_freeradius/mycert.pem',
  type   => 'key',
}
```

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::cert { 'mycert.pem':
  content => '<your key/cert content here>',
  type    => 'key',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::cert` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--cert--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--cert--content)
* [`type`](#-freeradius--cert--type)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--cert--ensure)

##### <a name="-freeradius--cert--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--cert--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--cert--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Set file permissions on the installed certificate differently depending on whether this is a private key or a public certificate.

Default value: `'key'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--cert--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

### <a name="freeradius--client"></a>`freeradius::client`

Define RADIUS clients as seen in `clients.conf`

#### Examples

##### Single host

```puppet
freeradius::client { "wlan-controller01":
  ip        => '192.168.0.1',
  secret    => 'testing123',
  shortname => 'wlc01',
  nastype   => 'other',
  port      => '1645-1646',
  firewall  => true,
}
```

##### Range

```puppet
freeradius::client { "wlan-controllers":
  ip        => '192.168.0.0/24',
  secret    => 'testing123',
  shortname => 'wlc01',
  nastype   => 'other',
  port      => '1645-1646',
  firewall  => true,
}
```

##### Huntgroup

```puppet
freeradius::client { "asa01":
  ip         => '192.168.0.1',
  secret     => 'testing123',
  huntgroups => [
    { name       => 'firewall',
      conditions => [ 'NAS-IP-Address == 192.168.0.1' ] },
  ]
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::client` defined type:

* [`secret`](#-freeradius--client--secret)
* [`shortname`](#-freeradius--client--shortname)
* [`ip`](#-freeradius--client--ip)
* [`ip6`](#-freeradius--client--ip6)
* [`proto`](#-freeradius--client--proto)
* [`require_message_authenticator`](#-freeradius--client--require_message_authenticator)
* [`virtual_server`](#-freeradius--client--virtual_server)
* [`nastype`](#-freeradius--client--nastype)
* [`login`](#-freeradius--client--login)
* [`password`](#-freeradius--client--password)
* [`coa_server`](#-freeradius--client--coa_server)
* [`response_window`](#-freeradius--client--response_window)
* [`max_connections`](#-freeradius--client--max_connections)
* [`lifetime`](#-freeradius--client--lifetime)
* [`idle_timeout`](#-freeradius--client--idle_timeout)
* [`redirect`](#-freeradius--client--redirect)
* [`port`](#-freeradius--client--port)
* [`srcip`](#-freeradius--client--srcip)
* [`firewall`](#-freeradius--client--firewall)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--client--ensure)
* [`attributes`](#-freeradius--client--attributes)
* [`huntgroups`](#-freeradius--client--huntgroups)

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--secret"></a>`secret`

Data type: `Freeradius::Secret`

The RADIUS shared secret used for communication between the client/NAS and the RADIUS server.

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--shortname"></a>`shortname`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A short alias that is used in place of the IP address or fully qualified hostname provided in the first line of the section.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--ip"></a>`ip`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The IP address of the client or range in CIDR format.
For IPv6, use `ipv6addr`. `ip` and `ip6` are mutually exclusive but one must be supplied.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--ip6"></a>`ip6`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The IPv6 address of the client or range in CIDR format. `ip` and `ip6` are mutually exclusive but one must be supplied.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--proto"></a>`proto`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['*', 'udp', 'tcp']]`

Transport protocol used by the client. If unspecified, defaults to "udp", which is the traditional RADIUS transport.

Default value: `'*'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--require_message_authenticator"></a>`require_message_authenticator`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Old-style clients do not send a Message-Authenticator in an Access-Request.
RFC 5080 suggests that all clients SHOULD include it in an Access-Request.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--virtual_server"></a>`virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The virtual server that traffic from this client should be sent to.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--nastype"></a>`nastype`

Data type:

```puppet
Optional[Enum[
      'cisco',
      'computone',
      'livingston',
      'juniper',
      'max40xx',
      'multitech',
      'netserver',
      'pathras',
      'patton',
      'portslave',
      'tc',
      'usrhiper',
      'other',
  ]]
```

Used to tell the `checkrad.pl` script which NAS-specific method it should use when checking simultaneous use.
See [`man clients.conf`](http://freeradius.org/radiusd/man/clients.conf.txt) for a list of all options.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--login"></a>`login`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Used by checkrad.pl when querying the NAS for simultaneous use.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--password"></a>`password`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Password]`

Used by checkrad.pl when querying the NAS for simultaneous use.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--coa_server"></a>`coa_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A pointer to the `home_server_pool` OR a `home_server` section that contains the CoA configuration for this client.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--response_window"></a>`response_window`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Response window for proxied packets.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--max_connections"></a>`max_connections`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Limit the number of simultaneous TCP connections from a client. It is ignored for clients sending UDP traffic.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--lifetime"></a>`lifetime`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The lifetime, in seconds, of a TCP connection. It is ignored for clients sending UDP traffic.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--idle_timeout"></a>`idle_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The idle timeout, in seconds, of a TCP connection. It is ignored for clients sending UDP traffic.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--redirect"></a>`redirect`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Integer,Array[Integer]]]`

The UDP port that this virtual server should listen on. Leave blank if this client is not tied to a virtual server.
Currently the port number is only used to create firewall exceptions and you only need to specify it if you set `firewall => true`.
Use port range syntax as in [`puppetlabs-firewall`](https://forge.puppetlabs.com/puppetlabs/firewall).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--srcip"></a>`srcip`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--firewall"></a>`firewall`

Data type: `Boolean`

Create a firewall exception for this virtual server. If this is set to `true`, you must also supply `port` and either `ip` or `ip6`.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--attributes"></a>`attributes`

Data type: `Variant[Array, Hash, String]`

Array of attributes to assign to this client.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--client--huntgroups"></a>`huntgroups`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Array of hashes, each hash defines one freeradius::huntgroup. Hash keys are all passed to a new instance of freeradius::huntgroup.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--config"></a>`freeradius::config`

Install arbitrary config snippets from a flat file. These are installed in `mods-config`

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::config { 'realm-checks.conf':
  source => 'puppet:///modules/site_freeradius/realm-checks.conf',
}
```

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::config { 'realm-checks.conf':
  content => template('your_template),
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::config` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--config--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--config--content)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--config--ensure)

##### <a name="-freeradius--config--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--config--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--config--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

### <a name="freeradius--dictionary"></a>`freeradius::dictionary`

Custom dictionaries are installed in `dictionary.d` and automatically included in the global dictionary.

freeradius::dictionary { 'mydict':

Default value: `undef`

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--home_server"></a>`freeradius::home_server`

This section defines a "Home Server" which is another RADIUS server that gets sent proxied requests.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::home_server` defined type:

* [`secret`](#-freeradius--home_server--secret)
* [`proto`](#-freeradius--home_server--proto)
* [`status_check`](#-freeradius--home_server--status_check)
* [`type`](#-freeradius--home_server--type)
* [`check_interval`](#-freeradius--home_server--check_interval)
* [`check_timeout`](#-freeradius--home_server--check_timeout)
* [`ipaddr`](#-freeradius--home_server--ipaddr)
* [`ipv6addr`](#-freeradius--home_server--ipv6addr)
* [`max_outstanding`](#-freeradius--home_server--max_outstanding)
* [`no_response_fail`](#-freeradius--home_server--no_response_fail)
* [`num_answers_to_alive`](#-freeradius--home_server--num_answers_to_alive)
* [`password`](#-freeradius--home_server--password)
* [`port`](#-freeradius--home_server--port)
* [`response_window`](#-freeradius--home_server--response_window)
* [`revive_interval`](#-freeradius--home_server--revive_interval)
* [`src_ipaddr`](#-freeradius--home_server--src_ipaddr)
* [`username`](#-freeradius--home_server--username)
* [`virtual_server`](#-freeradius--home_server--virtual_server)
* [`zombie_period`](#-freeradius--home_server--zombie_period)

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--secret"></a>`secret`

Data type: `Freeradius::Secret`

The shared secret use to "encrypt" and "sign" packets between FreeRADIUS and the home server.

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--proto"></a>`proto`

Data type: `Enum['udp', 'tcp']`



Default value: `'udp'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--status_check"></a>`status_check`

Data type: `Enum['none', 'status-server', 'request']`

Type of check to see if the `home_server` is dead or alive.

Default value: `'none'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['auth', 'acct', 'auth+acct', 'coa']`

Home servers can be sent Access-Request packets or Accounting-Request packets. Allowed values are:
* `auth` Handles Access-Request packets
* `acct` Handles Accounting-Request packets
* `auth+acct` Handles Access-Request packets at "port" and Accounting-Request packets at "port + 1"
* `coa` Handles CoA-Request and Disconnect-Request packets.

Default value: `'auth'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--check_interval"></a>`check_interval`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--check_timeout"></a>`check_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--ipaddr"></a>`ipaddr`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

IPv4 address or hostname of the home server. Specify one of `ipaddr`, `ipv6addr` or `virtual_server`

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--ipv6addr"></a>`ipv6addr`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

IPv6 address or hostname of the home server. Specify one of `ipaddr`, `ipv6addr` or `virtual_server`

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--max_outstanding"></a>`max_outstanding`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--no_response_fail"></a>`no_response_fail`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['no', 'yes']]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--num_answers_to_alive"></a>`num_answers_to_alive`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--password"></a>`password`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Password]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The transport protocol. If unspecified, defaults to "udp", which is the traditional
RADIUS transport. It may also be "tcp", in which case TCP will be used to talk to
this home server.

Default value: `1812`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--response_window"></a>`response_window`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--revive_interval"></a>`revive_interval`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--src_ipaddr"></a>`src_ipaddr`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--username"></a>`username`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--virtual_server"></a>`virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If you specify a `virtual_server` here, then requests will be proxied internally to that virtual server.
These requests CANNOT be proxied again, however. The intent is to have the local server handle packets
when all home servers are dead. Specify one of `ipaddr`, `ipv6addr` or `virtual_server`

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server--zombie_period"></a>`zombie_period`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--home_server_pool"></a>`freeradius::home_server_pool`

Configure home server pools

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::home_server_pool` defined type:

* [`home_server`](#-freeradius--home_server_pool--home_server)
* [`type`](#-freeradius--home_server_pool--type)
* [`virtual_server`](#-freeradius--home_server_pool--virtual_server)
* [`fallback`](#-freeradius--home_server_pool--fallback)

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server_pool--home_server"></a>`home_server`

Data type: `Variant[String, Array[String]]`

An array of one or more home servers (this must be an array even if you only have one home server). The names
of the home servers are NOT the hostnames, but the names of the sections. (e.g. `home_server foo {...}` has name "foo".

Note that ALL home servers listed here have to be of the same type. i.e. they all have to be "auth", or they all have to
be "acct", or they all have to be "auth+acct".

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server_pool--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['fail-over', 'load-balance', 'client-balance', 'client-port-balance', 'keyed-balance']`

The type of this pool controls how home servers are chosen.

* `fail-over` the request is sent to the first live home server in the list. i.e. If the first home server is marked "dead", the second
  one is chosen, etc.
* `load-balance` the least busy home server is chosen For non-EAP auth methods, and for acct packets, we recommend using "load-balance".
  It will ensure the highest availability for your network.
* `client-balance` the home server is chosen by hashing the source IP address of the packet. This configuration is most useful to do
  simple load balancing for EAP sessions
* `client-port-balance` the home server is chosen by hashing the source IP address and source port of the packet.
* `keyed-balance` the home server is chosen by hashing (FNV) the contents of the Load-Balance-Key attribute from the control items.

Default value: `'fail-over'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server_pool--virtual_server"></a>`virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A `virtual_server` may be specified here.  If so, the "pre-proxy" and "post-proxy" sections are called when
the request is proxied, and when a response is received.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--home_server_pool--fallback"></a>`fallback`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If ALL home servers are dead, then this "fallback" home server is used. If set, it takes precedence over any realm-based
fallback, such as the DEFAULT realm.

For reasons of stability, this home server SHOULD be a virtual server. Otherwise, the fallback may itself be dead!

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--huntgroup"></a>`freeradius::huntgroup`

Define a huntgroup given a name and the conditions under which a huntgroup matches a client.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::huntgroup { 'switchaccess':
  huntgroup  => 'switchaccess',
  conditions => [
    'NAS-IP-Address == 192.168.0.1',
  ],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::huntgroup` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--huntgroup--ensure)
* [`huntgroup`](#-freeradius--huntgroup--huntgroup)
* [`conditions`](#-freeradius--huntgroup--conditions)
* [`order`](#-freeradius--huntgroup--order)

##### <a name="-freeradius--huntgroup--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--huntgroup--huntgroup"></a>`huntgroup`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Name of the huntgroup to assign, if conditions are all met.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-freeradius--huntgroup--conditions"></a>`conditions`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Array of conditions which are used to match the client, each element should contain a condition in the form of 'Key == Value'.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--huntgroup--order"></a>`order`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String, Integer]]`



Default value: `50`

##### <a name="-freeradius--krb5--keytab"></a>`keytab`

Data type: `String`

Name of the service principal

##### <a name="-freeradius--krb5--start"></a>`start`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Connections to create during module instantiation. If the server cannot create specified number of
connections during instantiation it will exit. Set to 0 to allow the server to start without the
directory being available.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].start_servers}"`

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].min_spare_servers}"`

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].max_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--krb5--spare"></a>`spare`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].max_spare_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--krb5--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `'present'`

### <a name="freeradius--module"></a>`freeradius::module`

Install a module from a flat file, or enable a stock module that came with your distribution of
FreeRADIUS. Modules are installed into `mods-available` and automatically symlinked into
`mods-enabled`, to ensure compatibility with package managers. Any files in this directory that
are *not* managed by Puppet will be removed.

#### Examples

##### Enable a stock module

```puppet
freeradius::module { 'pap':
  preserve => true,
}
```

##### Install a custom module from a flat file

```puppet
freeradius::module { 'buffered-sql':
  source => 'puppet:///modules/site_freeradius/buffered-sql',
}
```

##### Install a custom module from a template

```puppet
freeradius::module { 'buffered-sql':
  content => template('some_template.erb)',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--module--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--module--content)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--ensure)
* [`preserve`](#-freeradius--module--preserve)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--preserve"></a>`preserve`

Data type: `Boolean`



Default value: `false`

### <a name="freeradius--module--detail"></a>`freeradius::module::detail`

Install a detail module to write detailed log of accounting records.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::detail` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--detail--ensure)
* [`filename`](#-freeradius--module--detail--filename)
* [`escape_filenames`](#-freeradius--module--detail--escape_filenames)
* [`permissions`](#-freeradius--module--detail--permissions)
* [`group`](#-freeradius--module--detail--group)
* [`header`](#-freeradius--module--detail--header)
* [`locking`](#-freeradius--module--detail--locking)
* [`log_packet_header`](#-freeradius--module--detail--log_packet_header)
* [`suppress`](#-freeradius--module--detail--suppress)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present','absent']`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--filename"></a>`filename`

Data type: `String`

The file where the detailed logs will go.

Default value: `"\${radacctdir}/%{%{Packet-Src-IP-Address}:-%{Packet-Src-IPv6-Address}}/detail-%Y%m%d"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--escape_filenames"></a>`escape_filenames`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If UTF-8 characters should be escaped from filename.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--permissions"></a>`permissions`

Data type: `String`

Unix-style permissions for the log file.

Default value: `'0600'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The Unix group which owns the log file.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--header"></a>`header`

Data type: `String`

Header to use in every entry in the detail file.

Default value: `'%t'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--locking"></a>`locking`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Enable if a detail file reader will be reading this file.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--log_packet_header"></a>`log_packet_header`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Log the package src/dst IP/port.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--detail--suppress"></a>`suppress`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Array of (sensitive) attributes that should be removed from the log.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `String`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--default_eap_type"></a>`default_eap_type`

Data type: `String`

Default EAP type.

Default value: `'md5'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--timer_expire"></a>`timer_expire`

Data type: `Integer`

How much time an entry is maintained in the list to correlate EAP-Response packets with EAP-Request packets.

Default value: `60`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ignore_unknown_eap_types"></a>`ignore_unknown_eap_types`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

By setting this options to `yes`, you can tell the server to keep processing requests with an EAP type it does not support.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--cisco_accounting_username_bug"></a>`cisco_accounting_username_bug`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Enables a work around to handle Cisco AP1230B firmware bug.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--max_sessions"></a>`max_sessions`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Maximum number of EAP sessions the server tracked.

Default value: `"\${max_requests}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--eap_pwd"></a>`eap_pwd`

Data type: `Boolean`

If set to `true` configures EAP-pwd authentication.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--pwd_group"></a>`pwd_group`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String,Integer]]`

`group` used in pwd configuration.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--pwd_server_id"></a>`pwd_server_id`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

`server_id` option in pwd configuration.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--pwd_fragment_size"></a>`pwd_fragment_size`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

`fragment_size` option in pwd configuration.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--pwd_virtual_server"></a>`pwd_virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The virtual server which determines the "known good" password for the user in pwd authentication.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--gtc_challenge"></a>`gtc_challenge`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The default challenge.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--gtc_auth_type"></a>`gtc_auth_type`

Data type: `String`

`auth_type` use in GTC.

Default value: `'PAP'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_config_name"></a>`tls_config_name`

Data type: `String`

Name for the `tls-config`. It normally should not be used.

Default value: `'tls-common'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_private_key_password"></a>`tls_private_key_password`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Password]`

Private key password.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_private_key_file"></a>`tls_private_key_file`

Data type: `String`

File with the private key of the server.

Default value: `"\${certdir}/server.pem"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_certificate_file"></a>`tls_certificate_file`

Data type: `String`

File with the certificate of the server.

Default value: `"\${certdir}/server.pem"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ca_file"></a>`tls_ca_file`

Data type: `String`

File with the trusted root CA list.

Default value: `"\${certdir}/ca.pem"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_auto_chain"></a>`tls_auto_chain`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

When setting to `no`, the server certificate file MUST include the full certificate chain.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_psk_identity"></a>`tls_psk_identity`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

PSK identity (if OpenSSL supports TLS-PSK).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_psk_hexphrase"></a>`tls_psk_hexphrase`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

PSK (hex) password (if OpenSSL supports TLS-PSK).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_dh_file"></a>`tls_dh_file`

Data type: `String`

DH file.

Default value: `"\${certdir}/dh"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_random_file"></a>`tls_random_file`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Random file.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_fragment_size"></a>`tls_fragment_size`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Fragment size for TLS packets.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_include_length"></a>`tls_include_length`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If set to no, total length of the message is included only in the first packet of a fragment series.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_check_crl"></a>`tls_check_crl`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Check the certificate revocation list.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_check_all_crl"></a>`tls_check_all_crl`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Check if intermediate CAs have been revoked.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_allow_expired_crl"></a>`tls_allow_expired_crl`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Allow use of an expired CRL.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ca_path"></a>`tls_ca_path`

Data type: `String`

Path to the CA file.

Default value: `"\${cadir}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_check_cert_issuer"></a>`tls_check_cert_issuer`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If set, the value will be checked against the DN of the issuer in the client certificate.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_check_cert_cn"></a>`tls_check_cert_cn`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If it is set, the value will be xlat'ed and checked against the CN in the client certificate.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cipher_list"></a>`tls_cipher_list`

Data type: `String`

Set this option to specify the allowed TLS cipher suites.

Default value: `'DEFAULT'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_disable_tlsv1_2"></a>`tls_disable_tlsv1_2`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Disable TLS v1.2.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_min_version"></a>`tls_min_version`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_max_version"></a>`tls_max_version`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ecdh_curve"></a>`tls_ecdh_curve`

Data type: `String`

Elliptical cryptography configuration.

Default value: `'prime256v1'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cache_enable"></a>`tls_cache_enable`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Enable TLS cache.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cache_lifetime"></a>`tls_cache_lifetime`

Data type: `Integer`

Lifetime of the cached entries, in hours.

Default value: `24`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cache_max_entries"></a>`tls_cache_max_entries`

Data type: `Integer`

The maximum number of entries in the cache.

Default value: `255`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cache_name"></a>`tls_cache_name`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Internal name of the session cache.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_cache_persist_dir"></a>`tls_cache_persist_dir`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Simple directory-based storage of sessions.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_verify_skip_if_ocsp_ok"></a>`tls_verify_skip_if_ocsp_ok`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If the OCSP checks suceed, the verify section is run to allow additional checks.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_verify_tmpdir"></a>`tls_verify_tmpdir`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Temporary directory where the client certificates are stored.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_verify_client"></a>`tls_verify_client`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The command used to verify the client certificate.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_enable"></a>`tls_ocsp_enable`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Enable OCSP certificate verification.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_override_cert_url"></a>`tls_ocsp_override_cert_url`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes` the OCSP Responder URL is overrided.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_url"></a>`tls_ocsp_url`

Data type: `String`

The URL used to verify the certificate when `tls_ocsp_override_cert_url` is set to `yes`.

Default value: `'http://127.0.0.1/ocsp/'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_use_nonce"></a>`tls_ocsp_use_nonce`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If the OCSP Responder can not cope with nonce in the request, then it can be set to `no`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_timeout"></a>`tls_ocsp_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Number of seconds before giving up waiting for OCSP response.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_ocsp_softfail"></a>`tls_ocsp_softfail`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

To treat OCSP errors as _soft_.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--tls_virtual_server"></a>`tls_virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Virtual server for EAP-TLS requests.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_default_eap_type"></a>`ttls_default_eap_type`

Data type: `String`

Default EAP type use inside the TTLS tunnel.

Default value: `'md5'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_copy_request_to_tunnel"></a>`ttls_copy_request_to_tunnel`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes`, any attribute in the ouside of the tunnel but not in the tunneled request is copied to the tunneled request.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_use_tunneled_reply"></a>`ttls_use_tunneled_reply`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes`, reply attributes get from the tunneled request are sent as part of the outside reply.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_virtual_server"></a>`ttls_virtual_server`

Data type: `String`

The virtual server that will handle tunneled requests.

Default value: `'inner-tunnel'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_include_length"></a>`ttls_include_length`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If set to no, total length of the message is included only in the first packet of a fragment series.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--ttls_require_client_cert"></a>`ttls_require_client_cert`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Set to `yes` to require a client certificate.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_default_eap_type"></a>`peap_default_eap_type`

Data type: `String`

Default EAP type used in tunneled EAP session.

Default value: `'mschapv2'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_copy_request_to_tunnel"></a>`peap_copy_request_to_tunnel`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes`, any attribute in the ouside of the tunnel but not in the tunneled request is copied to the tunneled request.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_use_tunneled_reply"></a>`peap_use_tunneled_reply`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes`, reply attributes get from the tunneled request are sent as part of the outside reply.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_proxy_tunneled_request_as_eap"></a>`peap_proxy_tunneled_request_as_eap`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Set the parameter to `no` to proxy the tunneled EAP-MSCHAP-V2 as normal MSCHAPv2.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_virtual_server"></a>`peap_virtual_server`

Data type: `String`

The virtual server that will handle tunneled requests.

Default value: `'inner-tunnel'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_soh"></a>`peap_soh`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Enables support for MS-SoH.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_soh_virtual_server"></a>`peap_soh_virtual_server`

The virtual server that will handle tunneled requests.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--peap_require_client_cert"></a>`peap_require_client_cert`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Set to `yes` to require a client certificate.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--mschapv2_send_error"></a>`mschapv2_send_error`

If set to `yes`, then the error message will be sent back to the client.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--eap--mschapv2_identity"></a>`mschapv2_identity`

### <a name="freeradius--module--files"></a>`freeradius::module::files`

Install a `file` module with users in freeradius.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::module::files {'myuserfile':
  users => [
    {
      login => 'DEFAULT',
      check_items => [
        'Realm == NULL'
      ],
      reply_items => [
        'Fall-Through = No
      ],
    },
  ],
}

# will produce a user file like:
DEFAULT Realm == NULL
  Fall-Through = No
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::files` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--files--ensure)
* [`moddir`](#-freeradius--module--files--moddir)
* [`key`](#-freeradius--module--files--key)
* [`filename`](#-freeradius--module--files--filename)
* [`usersfile`](#-freeradius--module--files--usersfile)
* [`acctusersfile`](#-freeradius--module--files--acctusersfile)
* [`preproxy_usersfile`](#-freeradius--module--files--preproxy_usersfile)
* [`users`](#-freeradius--module--files--users)
* [`source`](#-freeradius--module--files--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--module--files--content)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `String`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--moddir"></a>`moddir`

Data type: `String`

Directory where the users file is located.

Default value: `"\${modconfdir}/\${.:instance}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--key"></a>`key`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The default key attribute to use for matches.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--filename"></a>`filename`

Data type: `String`

The (old) users style filename.

Default value: `"\${moddir}/authorize"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--usersfile"></a>`usersfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Accepted for backups compatibility.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--acctusersfile"></a>`acctusersfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Accepted for backups compatibility.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--preproxy_usersfile"></a>`preproxy_usersfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Accepted for backups compatibility.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--users"></a>`users`

Data type: `Array`

Array of hashes with users entries (see "man users"). If entry in the hash is an array which valid keys are:
* `login`: The login of the user.
* `check_items`: An array with check components for the user entry.
* `reply_items`: An array with reply components for the user entry.

You should use just one of `users`, `source` or `content` parameters.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide source to a file with the users file.

You should use just one of `users`, `source` or `content` parameters.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--files--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide the content for the users file.

You should use just one of `users`, `source` or `content` parameters.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--module--huntgroup"></a>`freeradius::module::huntgroup`

Deprected: Use `freeradius::huntgroup` instead

* **See also**
  * `freeradius::module::preprocess`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::huntgroup` defined type:

* [`conditions`](#-freeradius--module--huntgroup--conditions)
* [`order`](#-freeradius--module--huntgroup--order)
* [`huntgroup`](#-freeradius--module--huntgroup--huntgroup)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--huntgroup--conditions"></a>`conditions`

Data type: `Variant[String,Array]`

Array of rules to match in this huntgroup.

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--huntgroup--order"></a>`order`

Data type: `Variant[String,Integer]`

Order of this huntgroup in the huntgroup files. This is the `order` parameter for the underlying `concat::fragment`.

Default value: `50`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--huntgroup--huntgroup"></a>`huntgroup`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The path of the huntgroup file.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--module--ippool"></a>`freeradius::module::ippool`

Install a `ippool` module

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::ippool` defined type:

* [`range_start`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--range_start)
* [`range_stop`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--range_stop)
* [`netmask`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--netmask)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--ensure)
* [`cache_size`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--cache_size)
* [`filename`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--filename)
* [`ip_index`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--ip_index)
* [`override`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--override)
* [`maximum_timeout`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--maximum_timeout)
* [`key`](#-freeradius--module--ippool--key)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--range_start"></a>`range_start`

Data type: `String`

The first IP address of the pool.

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--range_stop"></a>`range_stop`

Data type: `String`

The last IP address of the pool.

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--netmask"></a>`netmask`

Data type: `String`

The network mask used for the pool

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--cache_size"></a>`cache_size`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The gdbm cache size for the db files.
Defaults to the number of IP addresses in the range.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--filename"></a>`filename`

Data type: `String`

The main db file used to allocate address.

Default value: `"\${db_dir}/db.${name}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--ip_index"></a>`ip_index`

Data type: `String`

Helper db index file.

Default value: `"\${db_dir}/db.${name}.index"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--override"></a>`override`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set, the Framed-IP-Address already in the reply (if any) will be discarded.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--maximum_timeout"></a>`maximum_timeout`

Data type: `Integer`

Maximum time in seconds that an entry may be active.

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ippool--key"></a>`key`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The key to use for the session database.

Default value: `undef`
