##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--basedn"></a>`basedn`

Data type: `String`

Unless overridden in another section, the dn from which all searches will start from.

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`

Whether the site should be present or not.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--server"></a>`server`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of hostnames or IP addresses of the LDAP server(s). Note that this needs to match the name(s) in the LDAP
server certificate, if you're using ldaps.

Default value: `['localhost']`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Integer`

Port to connect to the LDAP server on.

Default value: `389`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--identity"></a>`identity`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

LDAP account for searching the directory.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--password"></a>`password`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Password]`

Password for the `identity` account.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--sasl"></a>`sasl`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Sasl]`

SASL parameters to use for admin binds to the ldap server. This is a hash with 3 possible keys:
* `mech`: The SASL mechanism used.
* `proxy`: SASL authorizatino identity to proxy.
* `realm`: SASL realm (used for kerberos)

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--valuepair_attribute"></a>`valuepair_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Generic valuepair attribute. If set, this attribute will be retrieved in addition to any mapped attributes.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--update"></a>`update`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Array with mapping of LDAP directory attributes to RADIUS dictionary attributes.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--edir"></a>`edir`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Set to `yes` if you have eDirectory and want to use the universal password mechanisms.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--edir_autz"></a>`edir_autz`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Set to `yes`if you want to bind as the user after retrieving the Cleartest-Password.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_base_dn"></a>`user_base_dn`

Data type: `String`

Where to start searching for users in the LDAP tree.

Default value: `"\${..base_dn}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_filter"></a>`user_filter`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `'(uid=%{%{Stripped-User-Name}:-%{User-Name}})'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_sasl"></a>`user_sasl`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Sasl]`

SASL parameters to use for user binds to the ldap server. This is a hash with 3 possible keys:
* `mech`: The SASL mechanism used.
* `proxy`: SASL authorizatino identity to proxy.
* `realm`: SASL realm (used for kerberos)

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_scope"></a>`user_scope`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Scope]`

Search scope for users.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_sort_by"></a>`user_sort_by`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Server side result sorting. A list of space delimited attributes to order the result set by.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_access_attribute"></a>`user_access_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If this undefined, anyone is authorized.
If it is defined, the contents of this attribute determine whether or not the user is authorised.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--user_access_positive"></a>`user_access_positive`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Control whether the presence of `access_attribute` allows access or denys access.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_base_dn"></a>`group_base_dn`

Data type: `String`

Where to start searching for groups in the LDAP tree.

Default value: `"\${..base_dn}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_filter"></a>`group_filter`

Data type: `String`

Filter for group objects.

Default value: `'(objectClass=posixGroup)'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_scope"></a>`group_scope`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Scope]`

Search scope for groups.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_name_attribute"></a>`group_name_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Attribute that uniquely identifies a group.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_membership_filter"></a>`group_membership_filter`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Filter to find group objects a user is member of.
That is, group objects with attributes that identify members (the inverse of `group_membership_attribute`).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_membership_attribute"></a>`group_membership_attribute`

Data type: `String`

The attribute in user objects which contain the namos or DNs of groups a user is a member of.

Default value: `'memberOf'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_cacheable_name"></a>`group_cacheable_name`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If `group_cacheable_name` or `group_cacheable_dn` are enabled, all group information for the user will be retrieved from the directory
and written to LDAP-Group attributes appropiaate for the instance of rlm_ldap.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_cacheable_dn"></a>`group_cacheable_dn`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If `group_cacheable_name` or `group_cacheable_dn` are enabled, all group information for the user will be retrieved from the directory
and written to LDAP-Group attributes appropiaate for the instance of rlm_ldap.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_cache_attribute"></a>`group_cache_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Override the normal cache attribute (`<inst>-LDAP-Group` or `LDAP-Group` if using the default instance) and create a custom attribute.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--group_attribute"></a>`group_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Override the normal group comparison attribute name (`<inst>-LDAP-Group` or `LDAP-Group` if using the default instance).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--profile_filter"></a>`profile_filter`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Filter for RADIUS profile objects.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--profile_default"></a>`profile_default`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The default profile. This may be a DN or an attribute reference.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--profile_attribute"></a>`profile_attribute`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The LDAP attribute containing profile DNs to apply in addition to the default profile above.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--client_base_dn"></a>`client_base_dn`

Data type: `String`

Where to start searching for clients in the LDAP tree.

Default value: `"\${..base_dn}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--client_filter"></a>`client_filter`

Data type: `String`

Filter to match client objects.

Default value: `'(objectClass=radiusClient)'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--client_scope"></a>`client_scope`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Search scope for clients.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--read_clients"></a>`read_clients`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

Load clients on startup.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--dereference"></a>`dereference`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['never','searching','finding','always']]`

Control under which situations LDAP aliases are followed.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--chase_referrals"></a>`chase_referrals`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

With `rebind` control whether the server follows references returned by LDAP directory. Mostly used for AD compatibility.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--rebind"></a>`rebind`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

With `chase_referrals` control whether the server follows references returned by LDAP directory. Mostly used for AD compatibility.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--use_referral_credentials"></a>`use_referral_credentials`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

On rebind, use the credentials from the rebind url instead of admin credentials.

This parameter should only be set when using FreeRADIUS 3.1.x.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--session_tracking"></a>`session_tracking`

Data type: `Optional[Freeradius::Boolean]`

If `yes`, then include draft-wahl-ldap-session tracking controls.

This parameter should only be set when using FreeRADIUS 3.1.x.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--timeout"></a>`timeout`

Data type: `Integer`

Number of seconds to wait for LDAP query to finish.

Default value: `10`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--timelimit"></a>`timelimit`

Data type: `Integer`

Seconds LDAP server has to process the query (server-side time limit).

Default value: `3`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--idle"></a>`idle`

Data type: `Integer`

Sets the idle time before keepalive probes are sent.

This option may not be supported by your LDAP library. If this configuration entry appears in the
output of `radiusd -X` then it is supported. Otherwise, it is unsupported and changing it will do nothing.

Default value: `60`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--probes"></a>`probes`

Data type: `Integer`

Sets the maximum number of keepalive probes TCP should send before dropping the connection.

This option may not be supported by your LDAP library. If this configuration entry appears in the
output of `radiusd -X` then it is supported. Otherwise, it is unsupported and changing it will do nothing.

Default value: `3`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--interval"></a>`interval`

Data type: `Integer`

Sets the interval in seconds between individual keepalive probes.

This option may not be supported by your LDAP library. If this configuration entry appears in the
output of `radiusd -X` then it is supported. Otherwise, it is unsupported and changing it will do nothing.

Default value: `3`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--ldap_debug"></a>`ldap_debug`

Data type: `String`

Debug flag for LDAP SDK.

Default value: `'0x0028'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--starttls"></a>`starttls`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Set this to 'yes' to use TLS encrypted connections to the LDAP database by using the StartTLS extended operation.
The StartTLS operation is supposed to be used with normal ldap connections instead of using ldaps (port 636) connections

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--cafile"></a>`cafile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Path to CA cert file for TLS

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--capath"></a>`capath`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Path to CA cert files for TLS

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--certfile"></a>`certfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Path to cert file for TLS

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--keyfile"></a>`keyfile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Path to key file for TLS

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--random_file"></a>`random_file`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Random file used for TLS operations.
`undef` defaults to `'/dev/urandom'`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--requirecert"></a>`requirecert`

Data type: `Enum['never','allow','demand','hard']`

Certificate Verification requirements. Choose from:
* `never` (do not even bother trying)
* `allow` (try, but don't fail if the certificate cannot be verified)
* `demand` (fail if the certificate does not verify)
* `hard`  (similar to `demand` but fails if TLS cannot negotiate)

Default value: `'allow'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--start"></a>`start`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Connections to create during module instantiation. If the server cannot create specified number of
connections during instantiation it will exit. Set to 0 to allow the server to start without the
directory being available.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].start_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--min"></a>`min`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Minimum number of connections to keep open.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].min_spare_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--max"></a>`max`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Maximum number of connections.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].max_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--spare"></a>`spare`

Data type: `Freeradius::Integer`

Spare connections to be left idle.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].max_spare_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--uses"></a>`uses`

Data type: `Integer`

How many times the connection can be used before being re-established. This is useful for things
like load balancers, which may exhibit sticky behaviour without it. `0` is unlimited.

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--retry_delay"></a>`retry_delay`

Data type: `Integer`

The number of seconds to wait after the server tries to open a connection, and fails.

Default value: `30`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--lifetime"></a>`lifetime`

Data type: `Integer`

The lifetime (in seconds) of the connection.

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--idle_timeout"></a>`idle_timeout`

Data type: `Integer`

Idle timeout (in seconds). A connection which is unused for this length of time will be closed.

Default value: `60`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--ldap--connect_timeout"></a>`connect_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Float]`

Connection timeout (in seconds). The maximum amount of time to wait for a new connection to be established.

This parameter should only be set when using FreeRADIUS 3.1.x.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--module--linelog"></a>`freeradius::module::linelog`

Install and configure linelog module to log text to files.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::linelog` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--ensure)
* [`filename`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--filename)
* [`escape_filenames`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--escape_filenames)
* [`permissions`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--permissions)
* [`group`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--group)
* [`syslog_facility`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--syslog_facility)
* [`syslog_severity`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--syslog_severity)
* [`format`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--format)
* [`reference`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--reference)
* [`messages`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--messages)
* [`accounting_request`](#-freeradius--module--linelog--accounting_request)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present','absent']`

If the module should `present` or `absent`.

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--filename"></a>`filename`

Data type: `String`

The file where the logs will go.

Default value: `"\${logdir}/linelog"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--escape_filenames"></a>`escape_filenames`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If UTF-8 characters should be escaped from filename.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--permissions"></a>`permissions`

Data type: `String`

Unix-style permissions for the log file.

Default value: `'0600'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The Unix group which owns the log file.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--syslog_facility"></a>`syslog_facility`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Syslog facility (if logging via syslog).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--syslog_severity"></a>`syslog_severity`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Syslog severity (if logging via syslog).

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--format"></a>`format`

Data type: `String`

The default format string.

Default value: `'This is a log message for %{User-Name}'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--reference"></a>`reference`

Data type: `String`

If it is defined, the line string logged is dynamically expanded and the result is used to find another configuration entry here, with
the given name. That name is then used as the format string.

Default value: `'messages.%{%{reply:Packet-Type}:-default}'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--messages"></a>`messages`

Data type: `Array[String]`

The messages defined here are taken from the `reference` expansion.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--linelog--accounting_request"></a>`accounting_request`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Similar to `messages` but for accounting logs.

Default value: `[]`

### <a name="freeradius--module--perl"></a>`freeradius::module::perl`

Installs the Perl module [rlm_perl](https://wiki.freeradius.org/modules/rlm_perl) with more advanced configuration

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::module::perl { 'somename':
  perl_filename  => 'scriptname.pl',
  path           => "puppet:///modules/profiles/radius_proxy/",
  function_names => $function_names,
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::module::perl` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--module--perl--ensure)
* [`moddir`](#-freeradius--module--perl--moddir)
* [`perl_filename`](#-freeradius--module--perl--perl_filename)
* [`path`](#-freeradius--module--perl--path)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--module--perl--content)
* [`function_names`](#-freeradius--module--perl--function_names)

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `file`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--moddir"></a>`moddir`

Data type: `String`



Default value: `"${fr_moduleconfigpath}/perl"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--perl_filename"></a>`perl_filename`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Filename of the Perl script.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--path"></a>`path`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The path of the source file on the Puppet server.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--module--perl--function_names"></a>`function_names`

Data type: `Optional[Hash[String, String]]`

If different function names to default are used, or if seperate functions for accounting start and stop are used, just pass a hash of
default and actual function names.
```puppet
$function_names = {
  "func_authenticate"     => "alternative_name",
  "func_start_accounting" => "start_function",
  "func_stop_accounting"  => "stop_function",
}
```

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--policy"></a>`freeradius::policy`

Install a policy from a flat file.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::policy` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--policy--source)
* [`order`](#-freeradius--policy--order)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--policy--ensure)

##### <a name="-freeradius--policy--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



##### <a name="-freeradius--policy--order"></a>`order`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: `50`

##### <a name="-freeradius--policy--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

### <a name="freeradius--realm"></a>`freeradius::realm`

Define a realm in `proxy.conf`. Realms point to pools of home servers.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::realm` defined type:

* [`virtual_server`](#-freeradius--realm--virtual_server)
* [`auth_pool`](#-freeradius--realm--auth_pool)
* [`acct_pool`](#-freeradius--realm--acct_pool)
* [`pool`](#-freeradius--realm--pool)
* [`nostrip`](#-freeradius--realm--nostrip)
* [`order`](#-freeradius--realm--order)

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--virtual_server"></a>`virtual_server`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Set this to "proxy" requests internally to a virtual server. The pre-proxy and post-proxy sections are run just as with any
other kind of home server.  The virtual server then receives the request, and replies, just as with any other packet.
Once proxied internally like this, the request CANNOT be proxied internally or externally.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--auth_pool"></a>`auth_pool`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

For authentication, the `auth_pool` configuration item should point to a `home_server_pool` that was previously
defined.  All of the home servers in the `auth_pool` must be of type `auth`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--acct_pool"></a>`acct_pool`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

For accounting, the `acct_pool` configuration item should point to a `home_server_pool` that was previously
defined.  All of the home servers in the `acct_pool` must be of type `acct`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--pool"></a>`pool`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If you have a `home_server_pool` where all of the home servers are of type `auth+acct`, you can just use the `pool`
configuration item, instead of specifying both `auth_pool` and `acct_pool`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--nostrip"></a>`nostrip`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Normally, when an incoming User-Name is matched against the realm, the realm name is "stripped" off, and the "stripped"
user name is used to perform matches.If you do not want this to happen, set this to `true`.

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-freeradius--realm--order"></a>`order`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Set custom order of realm fragments, otherwise they are automatically ordered alphabetically.

Default value: `30`

### <a name="freeradius--script"></a>`freeradius::script`

Install a helper script, e.g. which might be called upon by a virtual server. These are
placed in `scripts` and are not automatically included by the server.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::script` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--script--source)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--script--ensure)

##### <a name="-freeradius--script--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `String`



##### <a name="-freeradius--script--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

### <a name="freeradius--site"></a>`freeradius::site`

Install a virtual server (a.k.a. site) from a flat file. Sites are installed into `sites-available`
and automatically symlinked into `sites-enabled`, to ensure compatibility with package managers.
Any files in this directory that are *not* managed by Puppet will be removed.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::site` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--site--ensure)
* [`source`](#-freeradius--site--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--site--content)
* [`authorize`](#-freeradius--site--authorize)
* [`authenticate`](#-freeradius--site--authenticate)
* [`preacct`](#-freeradius--site--preacct)
* [`accounting`](#-freeradius--site--accounting)
* [`session`](#-freeradius--site--session)
* [`post_auth`](#-freeradius--site--post_auth)
* [`pre_proxy`](#-freeradius--site--pre_proxy)
* [`post_proxy`](#-freeradius--site--post_proxy)
* [`listen`](#-freeradius--site--listen)

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`

Whether the site should be present or not.

Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide source to a file with the configuration of the site.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide content for the configuartion of the site.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--authorize"></a>`authorize`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the authorize section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--authenticate"></a>`authenticate`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the authenticate section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--preacct"></a>`preacct`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the preacct section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--accounting"></a>`accounting`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the accounting section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--session"></a>`session`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the session section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--post_auth"></a>`post_auth`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the post-auth section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--pre_proxy"></a>`pre_proxy`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the pre-proxy section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--post_proxy"></a>`post_proxy`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Array of options (as String) for the post-proxy section of the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

##### <a name="-freeradius--site--listen"></a>`listen`

Data type: `Array[Hash]`

Array of listen definitions for the site.

This parameter is ignored if `source` or `content` are used.

Default value: `[]`

### <a name="freeradius--sql"></a>`freeradius::sql`

Configure SQL connections. You can define multiple database connections by
invoking this resource multiple times. If you are using MySQL, don't forget to
also set `mysql_support => true` in the base `freeradius` class.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
freeradius::sql { 'mydatabase':
  database  => 'mysql',
  server    => '192.168.0.1',
  login     => 'radius',
  password  => 'topsecret',
  radius_db => 'radius',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::sql` defined type:

* [`database`](#-freeradius--sql--database)
* [`password`](#-freeradius--sql--password)
* [`server`](#-freeradius--sql--server)
* [`login`](#-freeradius--sql--login)
* [`radius_db`](#-freeradius--sql--radius_db)
* [`num_sql_socks`](#-freeradius--sql--num_sql_socks)
* [`query_file`](#-freeradius--sql--query_file)
* [`custom_query_file`](#-freeradius--sql--custom_query_file)
* [`lifetime`](#-freeradius--sql--lifetime)
* [`max_queries`](#-freeradius--sql--max_queries)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--sql--ensure)
* [`acct_table1`](#-freeradius--sql--acct_table1)
* [`acct_table2`](#-freeradius--sql--acct_table2)
* [`postauth_table`](#-freeradius--sql--postauth_table)
* [`authcheck_table`](#-freeradius--sql--authcheck_table)
* [`authreply_table`](#-freeradius--sql--authreply_table)
* [`groupcheck_table`](#-freeradius--sql--groupcheck_table)
* [`groupreply_table`](#-freeradius--sql--groupreply_table)
* [`usergroup_table`](#-freeradius--sql--usergroup_table)
* [`deletestalesessions`](#-freeradius--sql--deletestalesessions)
* [`sqltrace`](#-freeradius--sql--sqltrace)
* [`sqltracefile`](#-freeradius--sql--sqltracefile)
* [`connect_failure_retry_delay`](#-freeradius--sql--connect_failure_retry_delay)
* [`nas_table`](#-freeradius--sql--nas_table)
* [`read_groups`](#-freeradius--sql--read_groups)
* [`port`](#-freeradius--sql--port)
* [`readclients`](#-freeradius--sql--readclients)
* [`pool_start`](#-freeradius--sql--pool_start)
* [`pool_min`](#-freeradius--sql--pool_min)
* [`pool_spare`](#-freeradius--sql--pool_spare)
* [`pool_idle_timeout`](#-freeradius--sql--pool_idle_timeout)
* [`pool_connect_timeout`](#-freeradius--sql--pool_connect_timeout)

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--database"></a>`database`

Data type: `Enum['mysql', 'mssql', 'oracle', 'postgresql']`

Specify which FreeRADIUS database driver to use.

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--password"></a>`password`

Data type: `Freeradius::Password`

Password to connect to the database.

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--server"></a>`server`

Data type: `Variant[Stdlib::Host, Stdlib::IP::Address]`

Specify hostname of IP address of the database server.

Default value: `'localhost'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--login"></a>`login`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Username to connect to the databae.

Default value: `'radius'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--radius_db"></a>`radius_db`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Name of the database. Normally you should leave this alone.

If you are using Oracle then use this instead:
`(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SID=your_sid)))`.

Default value: `'radius'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--num_sql_socks"></a>`num_sql_socks`

Data type: `Variant[Freeradius::Integer, Enum["\${thread[pool].max_servers}"]]`

Number of sql connections to make to the database server.
Setting this to LESS than the number of threads means that some threads may starve, and
you will see errors like "No connections available and at max connection limit". Setting
this to MORE than the number of threads means that there are more connections than necessary.
Leave blank to set it to the same value as the number of threads.

Default value: `"\${thread[pool].max_servers}"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--query_file"></a>`query_file`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

**`query_file` has been deprecated - use `custom_query_file` instead**

Relative path to the file which contains your SQL queries. By default, points to the `dialup.conf` specific to your database engine, so
leave this blank if you are using stock queries.

If you need to use custom queries, it is recommended that you deploy your query file using
`freeradius::script` to install the file into `scripts/custom_dialup.conf` and then
set `query_file` to `scripts/custom_dialup.conf`.

Default value: `"\${modconfdir}/\${.:name}/main/\${dialect}/queries.conf"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--custom_query_file"></a>`custom_query_file`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Puppet fileserver path to a file which contains your SQL queries, i.e. `dialup.conf`. This
option is intended to be a replacment for `query_file`, which requires separate deployment of the file. This
option allows you to specify a Puppet-managed custom `dialup.conf` which is installed and loaded automatically.
`query_file` must be left blank if you use `custom_query_file`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--lifetime"></a>`lifetime`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Lifetime of an SQL socket. If you are having network issues such as TCP sessions expiring, you may need to set the socket
lifetime. If set to non-zero, any open connections will be closed `$lifetime` seconds after they were first opened.

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--max_queries"></a>`max_queries`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Maximum number of queries used by an SQL socket. If you are having issues with SQL sockets lasting "too long", you can
limit the number of queries performed over one socket. After `$max_qeuries`, the socket will be closed. Use 0 for "no limit".

Default value: `0`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--acct_table1"></a>`acct_table1`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If you want both stop and start records logged to the same SQL table, leave this as is.  If you want them in
different tables, put the start table in `$acct_table1` and stop table in `$acct_table2`.

Default value: `'radacct'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--acct_table2"></a>`acct_table2`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If you want both stop and start records logged to the same SQL table, leave this as is.  If you want them in
different tables, put the start table in `$acct_table1` and stop table in `$acct_table2`.

Default value: `'radacct'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--postauth_table"></a>`postauth_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Table for storing data after authentication

Default value: `'radpostauth'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--authcheck_table"></a>`authcheck_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `'radcheck'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--authreply_table"></a>`authreply_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `'radreply'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--groupcheck_table"></a>`groupcheck_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `'radgroupcheck'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--groupreply_table"></a>`groupreply_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: `'radgroupreply'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--usergroup_table"></a>`usergroup_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Table to keep group info.

Default value: `'radusergroup'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--deletestalesessions"></a>`deletestalesessions`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Remove stale session if checkrad does not see a double login.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--sqltrace"></a>`sqltrace`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Print all SQL statements when in debug mode (-x).

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--sqltracefile"></a>`sqltracefile`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Location for SQL statements to be stored if `$sqltrace = yes`.

Default value: `"\${logdir}/sqllog.sql"`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--connect_failure_retry_delay"></a>`connect_failure_retry_delay`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Number of seconds to dely retrying on a failed database connection (per socket).

Default value: `60`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--nas_table"></a>`nas_table`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Table to keep radius client info.

Default value: `'nas'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--read_groups"></a>`read_groups`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

If set to `yes` (default) we read the group tables. If set to `no` the user MUST have `Fall-Through = Yes` in the radreply table.

Default value: `'yes'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

TCP port to connect to the database.

Default value: `3306`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--readclients"></a>`readclients`

Data type: `Freeradius::Boolean`

Set to `yes` to read radius clients from the database (`$nas_table`) Clients will ONLY be read on server startup. For performance
and security reasons, finding clients via SQL queries CANNOT be done "live" while the server is running.

Default value: `'no'`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--pool_start"></a>`pool_start`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Connections to create during module instantiation.

Default value: `1`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--pool_min"></a>`pool_min`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Minimum number of connnections to keep open.

Default value: `1`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--pool_spare"></a>`pool_spare`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Spare connections to be left idle.

Default value: `1`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--pool_idle_timeout"></a>`pool_idle_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Idle timeout (in seconds). A connection which is unused for this length of time will be closed.

Default value: `60`

##### <a name="-freeradius--sql--pool_connect_timeout"></a>`pool_connect_timeout`

Data type: `Optional[Float]`

Connection timeout (in seconds). The maximum amount of time to wait for a new
connection to be established.

This parameter should only be set when using FreeRADIUS 3.1.x.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--statusclient"></a>`freeradius::statusclient`

Define RADIUS clients, specifically to connect to the status server for monitoring.
Very similar usage to `freeradius::client` but with fewer options.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::statusclient` defined type:

* [`secret`](#-freeradius--statusclient--secret)
* [`ip`](#-freeradius--statusclient--ip)
* [`ip6`](#-freeradius--statusclient--ip6)
* [`port`](#-freeradius--statusclient--port)
* [`shortname`](#-freeradius--statusclient--shortname)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--statusclient--ensure)

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--secret"></a>`secret`

Data type: `Freeradius::Secret`

The RADIUS shared secret used for communication between the client/NAS and the RADIUS server.

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--ip"></a>`ip`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The IP address of the client in CIDR format. For IPv6, use `ipv6addr`. `ip` and `ip6` are mutually exclusive but one must be supplied.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--ip6"></a>`ip6`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The IPv6 address of the client in CIDR format. `ip` and `ip6` are mutually exclusive but one must be supplied.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The UDP port that this virtual server should listen on. Leave blank if this client is not tied to a virtual server.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--shortname"></a>`shortname`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A short alias that is used in place of the IP address or fully qualified hostname provided in the first line of the section.

Default value: `$name`

##### <a name="-freeradius--statusclient--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

### <a name="freeradius--template"></a>`freeradius::template`

Define template items that can be referred to in other config items

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::template` defined type:

* [`source`](#-freeradius--template--source)
* [`content`](#-freeradius--template--content)

##### <a name="-freeradius--template--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide source to a file with the template item. Specify only one of `source` or `content`.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-freeradius--template--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Provide content of template item. Specify only one of `source` or `content`.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="freeradius--virtual_module"></a>`freeradius::virtual_module`

Define a virtual module which consists of one or more other modules, for failover or load-balancing purposes.

#### Examples

##### Load virtual module myldap

```puppet
freeradius::virtual_module { 'myldap':
  submodules => ['ldap1', 'ldap2'],
  type       => 'redundant-load-balance',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `freeradius::virtual_module` defined type:

* [`submodules`](#-freeradius--virtual_module--submodules)
* [`ensure`](#-freeradius--virtual_module--ensure)
* [`type`](#-freeradius--virtual_module--type)

##### <a name="-freeradius--virtual_module--submodules"></a>`submodules`

Data type: `Array[String, 1]`

Provide an array of submodules which will be loaded into this virtual module.

##### <a name="-freeradius--virtual_module--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Freeradius::Ensure`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-freeradius--virtual_module--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['redundant','load-balance','redundant-load-balance','group']`

Type of virtual module. See [virtual modules](http://wiki.freeradius.org/config/Fail-over#virtual-modules)
and [load-balancing](http://wiki.freeradius.org/config/load-balancing) for more details.

Default value: `'redundant-load-balance'`

## Data types

### <a name="Freeradius--Boolean"></a>`Freeradius::Boolean`

Boolean in FreeRADIUS

Alias of `Enum['yes', 'no']`

### <a name="Freeradius--Ensure"></a>`Freeradius::Ensure`

The allowed ensure

Alias of `Enum['present', 'absent']`

### <a name="Freeradius--Integer"></a>`Freeradius::Integer`

Integer in FreeRADIUS

Alias of `Variant[Pattern[/^\$\{.+\}$/], Integer]`

### <a name="Freeradius--Password"></a>`Freeradius::Password`

Password pattern for FreeRADIUS

Alias of `Pattern[/\A[^\n]+\z/]`

### <a name="Freeradius--Sasl"></a>`Freeradius::Sasl`

Sasl type of FreeRADIUS

Alias of

```puppet
Struct[{
    mech  => Optional[String],
    proxy => Optional[String],
    realm => Optional[String],
  }]
```

### <a name="Freeradius--Scope"></a>`Freeradius::Scope`

Usable LDAP Scopes in FreeRADIUS

Alias of `Enum['base', 'one', 'sub', 'children']`

### <a name="Freeradius--Secret"></a>`Freeradius::Secret`

Secret pattern for FreeRADIUS

Alias of `Pattern[/\A[^\n]+\z/]`
